channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: They’ve got my number. https://t.co/ev1Jy88jXt

Allowing a rapist to prey on kids was a small price to pay to spread the glorious light of Torah. https://t.co/lTmd6G86ul
I shared my thoughts on Stolper the morning I learned of his death. But I’ve been thinking more of the cultural environment in which NCSY came to town in the late 70s. https://t.co/LMadGRGuQF
This was the dawn of the Christian Coalition, the eve of Reagan’s destructive election. It was a time of revival, of traditionalism in the aftermath of the 60s. Or so goes one narrative. https://t.co/OKknM9x0Vd
The implicit promise was that old time religion would help parents protect their children from these turbulent times.
So I’ve been thinking about some of the children of the people at the top of the NCSY hierarchy.
Yeshiva University sent its undergraduates across the country to save our young Jewish souls. YU, which had run its own youth group, closed it down rather than compete with NCSY — despite NCSY leaders telling teens to enroll at Touro instead, as it was frummer.
So Norman Lamm has his own failures not akin to those of Stolper. But did all his Torah study and mitzvah spreading keep his own son on the straight and narrow?
I guess that depends on how one characterizes voter fraud. https://t.co/YJNX4dnD0h
And then there is Rabbi Raphael Butler, Stolper’s successor at NCSY. How did Torah values work out for his family? https://t.co/oLuhPC16wM
@spooknine @trekonomics https://t.co/jmcyuSqgeL
Evergreen tweet. https://t.co/ogn6Hp3zNK
Wow. https://t.co/uuk9blQYpR
Let me know if any of the Jewish figures getting paid the big bucks to peddle “cancel culture” panic complain about this one. https://t.co/IXp6LYpYIU
Today in Republican social media. https://t.co/cQwUIo5pig
@jaymichaelson If you need a connection to New Jersey’s own Dr Oz, let me know.
Reconsidering Shamir. https://t.co/FcPsTq9nYD
@ZuckierShlomo @DrOz Want to support my pro-Dr Oz PAC? Our slogan is: “Dr. Oz. Because North Jersey deserves three Senate seats.”

Going to put in a plug for "Automate the Boring Stuff with Python," which I picked up from a previous Humble Bundle offer. https://t.co/KEBrH0oYkD
It enabled me to send an email to all the contributing authors announcing my Kickstarter campaign, along with attachments featuring customized jpgs promoting their stories. https://t.co/EsaEUe940q
Conversely: Being nice to people who are different than you is a small price to pay for joining the alliance to save America. https://t.co/iN9XChL3Qc
@cstross Add this to the list of applications of future technology that SF failed to predict.

That moment when someone asks in good faith why you’re running a Kickstarter campaign for a book you’re publishing, you give the full honest answer, and they respond by pledging at a top tier.
And that pledge pushes you past the 50% point.

@datadivajf @BBCRadio3 The price of insurrection.
@datadivajf @BBCRadio3 Sure, we don’t give you representation in a parliament that raises your taxes and is discussing freeing your slaves, but are you willing to lose access to the BBC?
@elivalley What if this is part of an ongoing, desperate plea for stochastic terrorism?
@froomkin @TheAtlantic @JeffreyGoldberg @gcaw Sweet. Jeffrey blocked me. Which is odd because I think I just retweeted his Atlantic piece about Zambia with total sincerity.

@elivalley If one Republican Senator were to stop breathing, Manchin wouldn’t matter.
@elivalley For that matter, if one were to be locked in Eric Greitan’s basement dungeon until the end of the session….
@popebuck1 @LawsuitsDevin @jaredsthumbs @shershovitz To be fair, the Ivies are notorious for putting people in front of a classroom with no actual training in pedagogy.
@DBashIdeas No. Videos would be a weird topic for you to write a book about. This is very on brand.
@phillyd97 @DBashIdeas I did send him an advance review copy of a book of short stories to peruse recently. https://t.co/cuclvzsCqF
@Atrios @goldberg_dan @jdvdub @tomscocca @jbouie @jesseltaylor At least you weren’t quaffing 70s TNR as a teen in real time like some of us….
@rafaelshimunov You think? When even Jewish progressives can’t avoid false charges of antisemitism? https://t.co/G1Z2Dv0Zoh
Interesting. As evangelical Christians ramp up their efforts to persecute gays, their younger generation isn’t going along. https://t.co/8xrXMX81jo
@TomPaineToday To quote the Wall St Journal, it would be irresponsible not to speculate.
